docs.snippet: Asian shares fell on Tuesday after investors took profits in high-flying U.S. technology shares on fears of stiffer regulation as Facebook came under fire following reports it allowed improper access to user data.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Fall as Facebook Data Flap Spooks Tech Stocks
headline.main: Asian Shares Fall as Facebook Data Flap Spooks Tech Stocks

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Friday it was suspending consulting firm Strategic Communication Laboratories (SCL) and its political data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica after it found they had violated its policies.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Suspends SCL, Cambridge Analytica for Violating Policies
headline.main: Facebook Suspends SCL, Cambridge Analytica for Violating Policies

docs.snippet: A data analysis firm employed by President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign tapped the Facebook profiles of more than 50 million users without their permission, allowing it to capitalize on the private social media activity of a large portion of the U...

headline.print_headline: Trump-Linked Data Analysis Firm Taps 50M Facebook Profiles
headline.main: Trump-Linked Data Analysis Firm Taps 50M Facebook Profiles

docs.snippet: Data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica harvested private information from more than 50 million Facebook users in developing techniques to support President Donald Trump's 2016 election campaign, the New York Times and London's Observer reported o...

headline.print_headline: Trump Consultants Harvested Data From 50 Million Facebook Users: Reports
headline.main: Trump Consultants Harvested Data From 50 Million Facebook Users: Reports

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Vladimir Putin, Facebook, White Rhino: Your Wednesday Briefing

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network, a step that follows a scandal over how Facebook handles personal information.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Cuts Ties to Data Brokers in Blow to Targeted Ads
headline.main: Facebook Cuts Ties to Data Brokers in Blow to Targeted Ads

docs.snippet: A U.S. judge has ordered Facebook Inc to let her review documents it has refused to give the Internal Revenue Service as that agency probes whether the social media company used an Irish unit to slash billions of dollars from its tax bill.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Must Give Judge Documents for U.S. Tax Probe of Irish Unit
headline.main: Facebook Must Give Judge Documents for U.S. Tax Probe of Irish Unit

docs.snippet: The U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee said on Monday it had invited the chief executive officers of Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc to testify at an April 10 hearing on data privacy.

headline.print_headline: Facebook CEO Among Those Invited to Testify at U.S. Senate Hearing
headline.main: Facebook CEO Among Those Invited to Testify at U.S. Senate Hearing

docs.snippet: Authorities in the U.S. and Europe are bearing down on Facebook and political data-mining firm Cambridge Analytica over allegations the firm stole data from 50 million Facebook users and used it to manipulate elections.

headline.print_headline: At a Glance: Calls to Probe Facebook, Data Firm on Privacy
headline.main: At a Glance: Calls to Probe Facebook, Data Firm on Privacy

docs.snippet: Opinion polls published on Sunday in the United States and Germany cast doubt over the level of trust people have in Facebook over privacy, as the firm ran advertisements in British and U.S. newspapers apologizing to users.

headline.print_headline: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data
headline.main: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data
